basic.floral_language:
Ranunculus asiaticus 
Floriography: nobel, refined, beautiful.
Ranunculus asiaticus is a small herbaceous plant. The flower is similar to tree ponies but smaller and well developed. Flower color varies. Petal are mostly polyphyll. It is very popular for pot cultivation and cut flower.
The plant prefers partial shade habitat, goes through dormancy in summer. It grows well in scatter light. Shade should be avoided in winter. The flower blooms in April to May for two to three weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period April-May, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes half shade environments, dormant in summer, put in places with scattered light, full sunlight in winter
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
